title: Riot is stuffed... Here's why
body:
Well everyone knows that the terms of service, everyone agrees on right? 
Let me point you out to some Knowledge on buying stuff.

When you buy RP and anything that uses RP is yours for that specific account. (get your shit outta here with that rented shit as that is BS)
from all perspectives when you buy something no matter what it is its yours to own no matter what, 
In league when u buy a champion you own it, When you buy a skin you own it, When you buy rp you own it. No matter what you OWN IT (you get the point)

Now i bought league of legends like i mean i own its property to a certain degree as i paid 24 dollars for the game at ebgames or something anyway that's not the point,
The point is i own it and when someone takes something away from you that you bought you can either (i'm guessing take it to court or make a big argument about it and get it back(refund))

To everyone that has banned accounts can get their money back as riot doesn't own what you buy they only created it (same principle goes to everything in the industry) i will give you examples as to the same analogy for different scenarios...
i.e buying a car from a dealer no matter what you do with it they cant take it away, buying a house if you destroy it you bought it so you replace it, if you buy a new iPhone apple cant do anything to take it back or ban you from using is as you bought it.

Everyone gets what i'm saying??? when you buy something from riot games no matter what it is (you own it)(you don't rent it)
Plus no law or terms of condition can come into consideration as it doesn't effect it.

Lastly for all the accounts that people reported that gets it banned is wrong and is Unlawful and riot has to give you your account back no matter the reason of its ban or, or you give it a chat ban. 

Anyway comment what you must but i am correct in all forms being, Riot get your game back up and give people their accounts back.

“4.3. Do I “own” the Virtual Goods I unlock? (No. What you “unlock” is not the virtual good itself, but rather, a qualified right to access it in the Game.)

We have the right to delete, alter, move, remove, or transfer any and all Game Content—including Virtual Goods—in whole or in part, at any time and for any reason or no reason, with or without notice to you, and with no liability of any kind to you. We don’t provide or guarantee, and expressly disclaim, any value, cash or otherwise, attributed to any data residing on servers we operate or control, including any Game Content attributed to your account. The sale or transfer of your right to access certain Virtual Goods, Blue Essence, Riot Points or Hextech Items may only be conducted via services approved of or provided by us, if any.

Seems like you might have read the ToS or at least skimmed it, but I think you need to go and actually read the ACL buddy.

You aren't buying anything, you are paying to access it.

For example, if you pay for a round of mini-golf, you are paying for access, not buying the clubs/course/etc.

This is the difference between goods and services, please learn it laz464, as you seem quite deluded on the subject.
